title: Accidental shooting suspect pleads not guilty
content:
IDAHO FALLS — Kevin McQuilliams, the man accused of accidently shooting and killing AnnaRae Ponce, the mother of his 4-year-old son, Michael, on Jan. 1 in Idaho Falls, pleaded not guilty to the charges against him Monday, according to court records.
McQuilliams, 26, is charged with aggravated assault with a deadly weapon, involuntary manslaughter, unlawful possession of a firearm, use of a firearm in the commission of felony and an enhancement for committing a felony with the intent to promote gang activity.
Witnesses reported that Ponce was shot and killed when McQuilliams threatened a 16-year-old boy with a weapon at the house party in the 900 block of South Emerson in the early hours of Jan. 1.
The witnesses said that a group of people showed up and an altercation ensued. Kevin fired his gun during the altercation, mistakenly killing Ponce.
McQuilliams was gone by the time police officers arrived at the house on South Emerson and a multi-state search commenced.
Police tracked the suspect via cell phone and pulled him over in Truckee, Calif., where he was arrested without incident.
Michael was with McQuilliams when he was arrested and he was placed in foster care. Family members said earlier this month that they are working to get the child placed with relatives in California.
Nubia B. Castillo-Mendoza, 20, and McQuilliam’s brother, Keith W. McQuilliams, 26, were also arrested last month on warrants for felony accessory to involuntary manslaughter, and for harboring McQuilliams after he allegedly killed Ponce on Jan. 1.
